content:
Please read https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bueditor/issues/12 I can not push the code even-though am listed as the maintainer of the module.

The module is referencing backdrop.org instead of backdropcms.org · Issue #12 · backdrop-contrib/bueditor
The modules js library files, in particular: library/bue.min.all.js library/bue.min.default.js library/bue.preview.js are referencing backdrop.org instead of backdropcms.org.
@Alan Mels I just fixed your permissions to that repo ...can you please try pushing again?

Thanks @klonos , it worked this time. Could you also please take a look at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/445#issuecomment-707894670 I am really frustration with often limitations and soon will start just keep modules we are working under github.com/altagrade

Change the default branch for the Shortcut module to 1.x-1.x and delete the master branch · Issue #445 · backdrop-ops/contrib
It's real shame contributors can not manage the branches for their projects. Once I had such an option, but then, for some reason, was deprived of such a right. I would love to get that right b...
AltaGrade LLC
Professional Drupal, Backdrop and WordPress hosting. - AltaGrade LLC

Sorry about that @Alan Mels ...the permissions have been set up by @jenlampton ...I'm just helping out by assigning them to the appropriate people. For any change to be made to the existing GitLab roles/permissions, there would need to be a discussion and we'd need to carefully examine what the change means security-wise...
...but if this happens to become an issue for any other project you are maintaining, please do the same as you've done now: post a comment here, and someone will help to assign proper role to you.
